meanings.sent1: The prearrangement of the meeting room ensured everything was ready on time.
meanings.sent2: We made a prearrangement to meet at the park before the concert.
meanings.sent3: The prearrangement for the surprise party was almost ruined when the guest of honor almost found out.
meanings.sent4: Her prearrangement of her schedule was like a well-orchestrated symphony.
meanings.sent5: The prearrangement of the seating chart made it easy for everyone to find their place.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging in advance.
meanings.sent1: His prearrangement of the travel details saved us a lot of time during the trip.
meanings.sent2: The prearrangement of the project timeline helped us stay on track.
meanings.sent3: The prearrangement of the surprise gift made her birthday even more special.
meanings.sent4: The prearrangement of the chess pieces on the board set the stage for an intense game.
meanings.sent5: The prearrangement of the party decorations created a festive atmosphere.
